SEARCH
Package com.example.paragonPioneerBackend.Controller.abstractController

Class SlugableController<Type extends Slugable,Repository extends SlugableReposetory<Type>,InputDto,Mapper extends ResponseMapper<Mapper,Type>,Service extends SlugableService<Type,Repository,InputDto>>

java.lang.Object
com.example.paragonPioneerBackend.Controller.abstractController.BaseController<Type,Repository,InputDto,Mapper,Service>
com.example.paragonPioneerBackend.Controller.abstractController.SlugableController<Type,Repository,InputDto,Mapper,Service>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BuildingController, GoodController, PopulationController, RecipeController
public abstract class SlugableController<Type extends Slugable,Repository extends SlugableReposetory<Type>,InputDto,Mapper extends ResponseMapper<Mapper,Type>,Service extends SlugableService<Type,Repository,InputDto>> extends BaseController<Type,Repository,InputDto,Mapper,Service>
This is an abstract controller class that extends the BaseController class and provides additional operations for entities that are Slugable. It is parameterized with the following types: - Type: The type of the Slugable entity that this controller manages. - Repository: The type of the SlugableReposetory that this controller uses to interact with the database. - InputDto: The type of the DTO that this controller accepts as input for creating and updating entities. - Mapper: The type of the ResponseMapper that this controller uses to map entities to their corresponding response DTOs. - Service: The type of the SlugableService that this controller uses to perform business logic operations.

The controller provides the following additional endpoints: - GET /: Returns the entity with the given slug, mapped to its corresponding response DTO. - GET /: Returns a set of entities that contain the given name, each mapped to its corresponding response DTO. - GET /: Returns the entity with the given ID, slug, or name, mapped to its corresponding response DTO.

    • getContainingName

      @GetMapping(value="/name/{name}", produces="application/json") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Mapper> getContainingName(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, @PathVariable String name)
      Retrieves all entities that contain the provided string in their name.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • findByIdSlugName

      @GetMapping(value="/find/{smth}", produces="application/json") @ResponseBody public Mapper findByIdSlugName(@PathVariable String smth)
      This method is used to find an entity by its ID, slug, or name. It first tries to parse the provided string as a UUID and find the entity by its ID. If the entity is not found by its ID, it tries to find the entity by its slug. If the entity is still not found, it tries to find the entity by its name. If the entity is not found by its ID, slug, or name, it throws an EntityNotFoundException.
      Parameters:
      smth - The string that represents the ID, slug, or name of the entity.
      Returns:
      The entity if found by its ID, slug, or name.
